Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk ipa-admintools
exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk ipa-client
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: ipa bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated ipa packages that fix several bugs are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. Red Hat Identity Management (IdM) is a centralized authentication, identity management, and authorization solution for both traditional and cloud-based enterprise environments.
This update fixes the following bugs:
* Previously, a bug prevented new Identity Management (IdM) certificate authority (CA) replica installations to update the CA master. Thus, during the CA replica installation, the temporary CA admin entry could not be submitted to the remote IdM CA master server. Consequently, the CA installation on the replica become unresponsive when polling the master indefinitely for this entry. The code that configures the CA replication on the remote master has been fixed to set all attributes required for the correct evaluation of access rules. As a consequence, updates from the CA replica to the master now work correctly and the CA installation no longer hangs. (BZ#1401953)
* The Identity Management (IdM) server upgrade procedure failed to detect if the DNS service on the host is managed by IdM. As a consequence, while upgrading an IdM replica that was installed without the DNS back end, the "named-pkcs11" service was restarted and the upgrade failed. The DNS installation status code has been fixed and now verifies correctly if IdM manages the BIND configuration file on the replica. As a result, upgrading IdM on a replica without DNS back end works correctly. (BZ#1404169)
* Previously, an Identity Management (IdM) 3.0 master on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 rejected IdM 4.0 and later replicas running on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. When installing the replicas, some attributes were not added to the replica config entry during the initial replication. Consequently, for example in migration scenarios, adding a Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 IdM replica to an existing Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 IdM master failed. The replica configuration routines have been updated. As a result, IdM now falls back to a Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6-compatible mode during the initial replication in the described scenario. (BZ#1404171)
* Previously, if an Identity Management (IdM) upgrade ran simultaneously on multiple servers, replication conflict entries were sometimes generated in the "cn=topology" subtree. If the domain level was raised while the conflict entries existed, the generated topology segment was sometimes distributed between correct and conflict entries. Also, one-directional segments fail to receive the data. As a consequence, IdM clients and commands fail. A patch has been applied to reject raising the domain level if replication conflicts exists. As a result, topology segments are created now only in a database without conflict entries. (BZ#1404338)
Users of ipa are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
